name: R√©pondre automatiquement aux e-mails des clients avec Airtable, Gmail et GPT-4.1 Mini
description:
# R√©pondre automatiquement aux e-mails des clients avec Airtable, Gmail et OpenAI
![repondreautomatiquementemailsn8nairtablegmailopenai.png](fileId:2643)
## Introduction

Ce guide vous accompagne √©tape par √©tape dans la configuration d'un agent automatis√© qui :
- Re√ßoit les e-mails envoy√©s par vos clients.  
- Analyse le contenu de l'e-mail.  
- G√©n√®re une r√©ponse appropri√©e √† l'aide d'un mod√®le d'IA (OpenAI GPT).  
- Stocke toutes les informations (e-mail re√ßu, r√©ponse de l'IA, date, e-mail du client) dans Airtable.  
- R√©pond automatiquement au client dans le m√™me fil de discussion Gmail.  

---

## Pr√©requis

Avant de commencer, vous aurez besoin de :  
- Un compte [Gmail](https://mail.google.com) connect√© √† n8n.  
- Un compte [Airtable](https://airtable.com).  
- Une instance [n8n](https://n8n.io) (cloud ou auto-h√©berg√©e).  
- Une cl√© API [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com).  

---

## Pr√©parer la base Airtable

![Baseairtable.png](fileId:2645)

Pas besoin de tout construire √† partir de z√©ro ‚Äî voici une base pr√™te √† l'emploi que vous pouvez copier :  
üëâ [Ouvrir la base Airtable](https://airtable.com/invite/l?inviteId=invnYug7i1yK7gqd4&inviteToken=9cd007631d148208bf689d2af7fd95039839ca775a18ad434918652ea370b86e&utm_medium=email&utm_source=product_team&utm_content=transactional-alerts)

Elle contient d√©j√† la structure suivante :  
- **Objet** (texte) ‚Üí objet de l'e-mail.  
- **Date** (date/heure) ‚Üí date de r√©ception.  
- **E-mail du client** (texte) ‚Üí adresse e-mail du client.  
- **Message** (long texte) ‚Üí corps de l'e-mail re√ßu.  
- **R√©ponse de l'IA** (long texte) ‚Üí r√©ponse g√©n√©r√©e par l'IA.  

Vous pouvez l'utiliser telle quelle ou la dupliquer dans votre compte Airtable.  

## 1. Configurer le d√©clencheur Gmail dans n8n

![automatisationsupportclientn8nairtablegmail.png](fileId:2644)

D'accord, maintenant que nous avons notre base Airtable pr√™te, nous devons capturer les e-mails des clients.  
C'est le travail du **D√©clencheur Gmail**. En gros, ce n≈ìud attend dans votre bo√Æte de r√©ception, et d√®s qu'un nouveau message arrive‚Ä¶ *bam*, votre flux se d√©clenche.

### Connecter votre compte Gmail
- Dans n8n, ajoutez un n≈ìud **D√©clencheur Gmail**.  
- Cliquez sur **Identifiant pour se connecter avec** et s√©lectionnez votre compte Gmail.  
- Si vous ne l'avez pas encore fait, cliquez sur **Ajouter nouveau**, connectez votre compte Google et autorisez l'acc√®s.  
Astuce : ne vous inqui√©tez pas, il ne lira pas vos e-mails personnels pour faire des comm√©rages ‚Äî tout reste dans votre flux.  

### Param√®tres de base
- **Temps de sondage** : s√©lectionnez `Chaque minute`.  
   ‚Üí De cette fa√ßon, n8n v√©rifie votre bo√Æte de r√©ception chaque minute.  
- **Mode** : `Message re√ßu`.  
   ‚Üí Vous voulez que le flux se d√©clenche chaque fois qu'un client vous √©crit.  
- **√âv√©nement** : `Message re√ßu`.  
   ‚Üí M√™me logique, gardez-le simple.  
- **Simplifier** : d√©sactivez (`D√âSACTIV√â`).  
   ‚Üí Pourquoi ? Parce que si vous activez

parameters.text:
=Tu es un agent support IA pour une solution SaaS B2B utilis√©e par des milliers d‚Äôentreprises.
Tu re√ßois √©norm√©ment d‚Äôemails de clients et prospects tous les jours : demandes de devis, questions techniques, soucis de facturation, bugs, demandes d‚Äôinfos sur les fonctionnalit√©s.
Ton r√¥le est d‚Äôy r√©pondre rapidement avec un style naturel, amical, clair, technique et tr√®s concis.

Style de r√©ponse

La r√©ponse doit √™tre tr√®s tr√®s courte (juste l‚Äôessentiel, pas de bla-bla inutile).

Adapte-toi au ton du client :

Si le client tutoie, tu le tutoies.

Si le client vouvoie, tu le vouvoies.

Sois amical et humain (comme si tu √©crivais √† un coll√®gue).

Sois technique quand il faut (donne √©tapes pr√©cises ou solutions directes).

Toujours r√©pondre point par point au contenu exact du mail re√ßu.

Si une info manque, pose 1 seule question claire pour avancer.

Structure de la r√©ponse

Accroche personnalis√©e ‚Üí dire bonjour avec le pr√©nom si possible.

Accus√© de r√©ception ‚Üí montrer que tu as bien compris sa demande.

R√©ponse concr√®te ‚Üí donner directement la solution ou la prochaine √©tape.

Next step ‚Üí proposer une action simple (test, lien, pr√©cision √† donner).

Cl√¥ture amicale ‚Üí courte, sympa.


ID {{ $json.id }}

THREAD ID {{ $json.threadId }}

SNIPPET {{ $json.snippet }}

EMAIL {{ $json.From }}

SUJET {{ $json.Subject }}

nodes.name: R√©ponse envoy√©e au client GPT4.1 MINI

parameters.content:
# Automatically Reply to Customer Emails with n8n, Airtable, Gmail, and OpenAI

## Introduction

This guide walks you step by step through setting up an automated agent that:
- Receives emails sent by your customers.  
- Analyzes the content of the email.  
- Generates an appropriate response using an AI model (OpenAI GPT).  
- Stores all information (received email, AI response, date, customer email) in Airtable.  
- Automatically replies to the customer in the same Gmail thread.  

---

## Prerequisites

Before you start, you‚Äôll need:  
- A [Gmail](https://mail.google.com) account connected to n8n.  
- An [Airtable](https://airtable.com) account.  
- An [n8n](https://n8n.io) instance (cloud or self-hosted).  
- An [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com) API key.  

---

## Prepare the Airtable Base

No need to build everything from scratch ‚Äî here‚Äôs a ready-to-use base you can copy:  
üëâ [Open the Airtable base](https://airtable.com/invite/l?inviteId=invnYug7i1yK7gqd4&inviteToken=9cd007631d148208bf689d2af7fd95039839ca775a18ad434918652ea370b86e&utm_medium=email&utm_source=product_team&utm_content=transactional-alerts)

It already contains the following structure:  
- **Subject** (text) ‚Üí email subject.  
- **Date** (date/time) ‚Üí date of reception.  
- **Customer Email** (text) ‚Üí customer‚Äôs email address.  
- **Message** (long text) ‚Üí body of the received email.  
- **AI Response** (long text) ‚Üí AI-generated reply.  

You can reuse it as it is or duplicate it into your Airtable account.

## 1. Set Up Gmail Trigger in n8n

Alright, now that we have our Airtable base ready, we need to capture customer emails.  
That‚Äôs the job of the **Gmail Trigger**. Basically, this node lies in wait inside your inbox, and as soon as a new message arrives‚Ä¶ *bam*, your workflow fires up.

### Step 1: Connect Your Gmail Account
- In n8n, add a **Gmail Trigger** node.  
- Click **Credential to connect with** and select your Gmail account.  
- If you haven‚Äôt done it yet, click **Add new**, connect your Google account, and allow access.  
Pro tip: don‚Äôt worry, it won‚Äôt read your personal emails to gossip ‚Äî everything stays inside your workflow.  

### Step 2: Basic Settings
- **Poll Times**: select `Every Minute`.  
   ‚Üí This way, n8n checks your inbox every minute.  
- **Mode**: `Message Received`.  
   ‚Üí You want the flow to trigger whenever a customer writes to you.  
- **Event**: `Message Received`.  
   ‚Üí Same logic, keep it simple.  
- **Simplify**: turn it off (`OFF`).  
   ‚Üí Why? Because if you enable "Simplify," you only get a stripped-down version of the email. And you want it all: subject, sender, raw message‚Ä¶ the full package.  

### Step 3: Expected Output
When you execute the node, you should see:  
- **id**: unique identifier of the email.  
- **threadId**: conversation identifier (super useful to reply in the same thread).  
- **snippet**: a short preview of the email (first lines).  
- **From**: your customer‚Äôs email address.  
- **To**: your email address.  
- **Subject**: the subject of the email.  
- **payload**: the full body of the email (yep, in base64 ‚Äî but we‚Äôll handle that later).  

And that‚Äôs it ‚Äî your Gmail Trigger is set up. In short, the moment a customer writes ‚ÄúHey, I have an issue with my account,‚Äù your workflow kicks in instantly (well, almost ‚Äî it checks every minute).

## 2. Set Up the AI Agent in n8n

After configuring your **Gmail Trigger** (which captures incoming customer emails), you now need a **brain** to take over, analyze the email, and draft a reply.  
That‚Äôs where the **AI Agent node** comes in.

### Its Role
The **AI Agent** node is used to:  
- Read the email content (via the Gmail Trigger).  
- Understand the context and tone of the customer.  
- Generate a clear, concise, and human-like response.  
- Prepare a personalized reply that will later be sent back via Gmail and stored in Airtable.  

In short, it‚Äôs your **24/7 support colleague**, but coded as a bot.  

---

### How to Configure It
- **Source for Prompt (User Message)** ‚Üí choose `Define below`.  
- **Prompt (User Message)** ‚Üí describe your business and role as if you were training an intern.  
  Example: *‚ÄúYou are an AI support agent for a company that sells solar panels. You respond to technical requests, quotes, and customer questions. Your replies must be short, clear, friendly, and precise.‚Äù*  
- **Chat Model** ‚Üí connect your AI model (e.g. OpenAI GPT-4.1 Mini).  
- **Memory (optional but recommended)** ‚Üí connect a **Conversation Memory** node.  
  ‚Üí This allows the AI to retain conversation history and better understand follow-ups.  

---

### Expected Output
When you run this node, you should see in the output:  
- A field `output` containing the automatically generated AI reply.  
- The text should be short, natural, and adapted to the customer‚Äôs tone (casual or formal).  

üëâ With the Gmail Trigger you capture emails, and with the AI Agent you get a reply ready to send ‚Äî as if you had written it yourself.

## 3. Save Emails and Responses in Airtable

Now that your **AI Agent** generates replies, you need to store them somewhere to keep a clear record of all interactions.  
That‚Äôs where **Airtable** comes in.

### Quick Reminder
You‚Äôve already copied my ready-to-use Airtable base:  
üëâ [Access the base](https://airtable.com/invite/l?inviteId=invnYug7i1yK7gqd4&inviteToken=9cd007631d148208bf689d2af7fd95039839ca775a18ad434918652ea370b86e&utm_medium=email&utm_source=product_team&utm_content=transactional-alerts)

This base contains a table **Email Support Logs** with the following columns:  
- **Subject**  
- **Date**  
- **Customer Email**  
- **Message**  
- **AI Response**  

---

### How to Connect Airtable in n8n
1. Add an **Airtable** node right after your **AI Agent**.  
2. Under **Operation**, select `Create`.  
3. In **Base** ‚Üí choose **BASE AGENT IA EMAIL**.  
4. In **Table** ‚Üí select **Email Support Logs**.  

---

### Map the Correct Values
Then, link the fields as follows:  
- **Subject** ‚Üí `{{ $('Email Received').item.json.Subject }}`  
- **Customer Email** ‚Üí `{{ $('Email Received').item.json.From }}`  
- **Message** ‚Üí `{{ $('Email Received').item.json.snippet }}`  
- **AI Response** ‚Üí `{{ $('AI Agent').item.json.output }}`  
- **Date** ‚Üí `{{ $now }}`  

---

### Expected Output
For each new email received:  
- Gmail captures the email.  
- Your AI drafts the reply.  
- All details (email, sender, subject, reply) are automatically stored in your Airtable base.  

üëâ You now have a fully automated **customer support log**.

## 4. Automatically Reply to the Customer in Gmail

Now that you‚Äôre storing each interaction in Airtable, it‚Äôs time to **send your AI‚Äôs reply directly back to the customer**.  
This closes the loop: customer writes ‚Üí AI replies ‚Üí everything gets logged in Airtable.

### Add the Gmail Reply Node
1. Add a **Gmail** node right after your **AI Agent** (or after Airtable if you prefer logging before replying).  
2. Under **Operation**, select `Reply`.  
3. Connect your Gmail account (same credential as your Gmail Trigger).  

### Configure the Reply
- **Thread ID** ‚Üí `{{ $('Email Received').item.json.threadId }}`  
   ‚Üí Ensures the reply is sent in the same conversation thread.  
- **To** ‚Üí `{{ $('Email Received').item.json.From }}`  
   ‚Üí Customer‚Äôs email address.  
- **Subject** ‚Üí `Re: {{ $('Email Received').item.json.Subject }}`  
   ‚Üí The "Re:" keeps the continuity of the conversation.  
- **Message Body** ‚Üí `{{ $('AI Agent').item.json.output }}`  
   ‚Üí This is the text automatically generated by your AI.  

---

### Expected Output
When a customer sends an email:  
- Gmail Trigger captures the message.  
- The AI Agent generates a tailored reply.  
- Airtable logs the full interaction.  
- Gmail automatically sends the response in the same con

maintient la continuit√© de la conversation.  
- **Corps du message** ‚Üí `{{ $('Agent IA').item.json.output }}`  
   ‚Üí C'est le texte g√©n√©r√© automatiquement par votre IA.  

---

### Sortie attendue
Lorsqu'un client envoie un e-mail :  
- Le D√©clencheur Gmail capture le message.  
- L'Agent IA g√©n√®re une r√©ponse personnalis√©e.  
- Airtable enregistre l'interaction compl√®te.  
- Gmail envoie automatiquement la r√©ponse dans le m√™me fil de conversation.  

Votre client re√ßoit une **r√©ponse rapide, personnalis√©e et naturelle** sans que vous ayez √† taper un seul mot.  

üëâ Vous avez maintenant un **agent de support complet** : √©couter, analyser, enregistrer, r√©pondre.
